poem:
Title: In the Foe's Shadows

Seven battlegrounds wake in the morn.
Lying shivering below democracy's scorn.
In ties of past the enemy worn, 
We draw our contrasts, sharp as thorn. 
Arizona, Michigan, the Northern horn,
Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, fresh hope reborn.
Silent our moves, like the hushed mourn.
The sun, our beacon, to old patterns torn.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Democrats target statehouse races in first big campaign spend of 2024 Democrats are targeting seven battlegrounds in their first campaign spend of the year on state legislature elections, the Guardian has learned, and intend to draw “clear contrasts” with Republican candidates tied to former US president Donald Trump. The latest round of investments will deliver “critical resources” to Arizona, Michigan, Minnesota, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, the Democratic Legislative Campaign Committee (DLCC) said.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
